summary: This document is a set of 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the date August 9, 2019. The sheets are used to document staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it pertains to the date of Jeffrey Epstein's death while in custody.

events.title: Inmate Observation Logs
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were documented throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a prison log sheet from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 9, 2019.
It details a 30-minute inmate observation protocol for inmates in continuous locked-down status.
The logs cover multiple tiers (L-Tier, M-Tier, ZA Tier-J, K, G, H, ZB) within the Special Housing Unit.
The document is part of the records from the date Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.
It includes signature lines for Morning Watch, Day Watch, and Evening Watch operations lieutenants and a reviewing captain.
